Public Notes: Sam's Club pharmacists expect that they will be part of the vaccination effort, but corporate has not yet announced California distribution plans.

As of March 2:  Kaiser statewide is vaccinating healthcare workers, residents of long-term care facilities, people 65+, and educators (K-12) who have an accessibility code. In Northern California, there is an expanded list, open to agriculture and food workers, child care workers and emergency services workers.
Detailed appointment information available the Kaiser website, <http://kp.org>  You also can try to get an appointment by calling the central hotline at [866-454-8855](tel:1-866-454-8855). Existing eligible patients may also receive information on booking a vaccine appointment via letter or email.

As of Feb 13: Sutter's website reports 'Due to a lack of vaccine supply we are currently unable to book appointments for a first vaccination until further notice.'
 

Sutter patients can book appointments by signing into My Health Online using the sign-in button here: <https://www.sutterhealth.org/for-patients/health-alerts/covid-19-vaccine>

Once you choose a date and location to book an appointment, you can also choose to be added to a waitlist in case an earlier spot opens up.

Appointments are typically booked out online until more supply arrives but people might cancel. Availability and eligibility is managed on a county-by-county basis .

Same pharmacy chain as Von's, Safeway, Sav-on.

As of February 7, 2021: Walmart has not yet announced any plans to distribute the covid vaccine in California. From our conversations with pharmacists, we think they will be a vaccination option sometime this spring.
As of February 7, many locations are offering the vaccine to people who are eligible based on county guidelines.  Vaccine appointments can be made online, though space is typically limited.
As of Feb 7, 2021: UCSF is vaccinating workers who are 1a as well as patients and employees over 65. Appointments are made through MyChart.

As of Feb 7, 2021: Some Walgreens have begun vaccinating people who are eligible according to county guidelines. In other counties, Walgreens are only vaccinating residents of long-term care facilities.  Walgreens intends to increase vaccine availability to the public over the course of the spring.

As of 2021-01-18: It seems the store is not yet administering the vaccine but will be soon at these locations 

https://fox40.com/news/local-news/grocery-store-chain-helps-expand-covid-19-vaccination-sites-in-sacramento-stanislaus-counties/

As of 2021-02-08: The vaccine is being offered on a very limited basis. "vaccination is only by appointment and only to those who are eligible which includes health care workers and seniors over the age of 65. 
Customers can get vaccinated at two stores in Sacramento, one in Carmichael and locations in Ceres, Modesto, Riverbank and Patterson. "
[Grocery store chain helps expand COVID-19 vaccination sites in Sacramento, Stanislaus counties | FOX40](https://fox40.com/news/local-news/grocery-store-chain-helps-expand-covid-19-vaccination-sites-in-sacramento-stanislaus-counties/)
As of February 7, 2021: The Medicine Shoppe is not currently distributing the covid vaccine in California with no announced plans to do so.
As of February 7, the location is vaccinating people 65+ who live or work in Santa Clara County.  However, appointment slots are fully booked.  Appointments can be booked online.
Limited quantities available now at most locations, for people who meet county eligibility guidelines
As of February 7, 2021: many but not all Rite-Aid locations are offering vaccine to the public in line with county guidelines.

Appointments are typically booked out online until more supply arrives but people might cancel. Availability and eligibility is managed on a county-by-county basis.

Same pharmacy chain as Von's, Safeway, Sav-on.

Appointments are typically booked out online until more supply arrives but people might cancel. Availability and eligibility is managed on a county-by-county basis.

Same pharmacy chain as Von's, Safeway, Sav-on.

Provider: Blue Cross Blue Shield of CA
Public Notes: 2021-02-08 BCBS of CA is taking over the roll out of the vaccine- they will be tracking the vaccine from order to injection. They use the [Myturn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) website for allowing people to check their eligibility and schedule appointments. Their [website links to pharmacies that may have vaccines.](https://www.blueshieldca.com/bsca/bsc/wcm/connect/sites/sites_content_en/coronavirus/vaccine-locations)

[2/4] Established patients of Stanford Health Care who meet the following criteria may schedule a vaccination via [MyHealth](https://myhealth.stanfordhealthcare.org/#/appointments/apptmake) or by calling 650-498-9000.

We are now able to schedule vaccination appointments through MyHealth for:
- Health care workers who work in Alameda, Contra Costa, San Mateo, or Santa Clara county
- Patients who have received care at Stanford Health Care at least once in the last three years, are aged 65+, and live in Alameda, Contra Costa, San Mateo, or Santa Clara county

For more information, visit [https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/patient-care/safety-health-vaccine-planning.html](https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/patient-care/safety-health-vaccine-planning.html?ecid=ecc-olm-na-na-all-na-Dec20-surl_covid19updates)).

2021-02-08: Stanford Health Care patients who are 65+ and Health Care Workers (and meet the criteria, patients who have had care at least once in the past three years with Stanford Health Care, and who meet current eligibility requirements set by the state and county), can schedule appointments at four Stanford Health Care locations, as well as wherever it is the most convenient through County Resources. 
They continue to use [MyHealth](https://myhealth.stanfordhealthcare.org/#/appointments/apptmake) or by calling 650-498-9000. for scheduling.

As of February 7, 2021: One Medical is offering the covid vaccine to members who meet eligibility requirements in a number of counties. Some locations are still restricted to 1a / healthcare workers, while others are also vaccinating patients 65 or 75+.  Supply is limited.

One Medical will contact members via email to let them know if their region has moved to the next eligibility phase. When a member is eligible, they can self-book appointments using the app or web portal.  No appointments will be made by phone.
Raley's expects to receive vaccine allocations "soon" but as of Feb 7, has yet to announce when it will begin vaccination

CVS has announced they will start vaccinating statewide at “select” locations on February 11, 2021. Appointments will be open for scheduling on February 9, 2021 at <https://www.cvs.com/vaccine/intake/store/covid-screener/covid-qns>

As of 2021-02-07: John Muir Health is offering vaccines to patients age 75+. On February 15, they will begin to offer vaccine appointments to patients age 65-74, and will also continue to offer appointments to patients age 75+. Both age groups will have appointment slots reserved. 
John Muir is reaching out to patients to schedule vaccination appointments. There is no way to request an appointment nor a waitlist or registry. They will be contacting patients in a variety of ways including MyChart messages, email, text messages and phone calls. 
Their vaccine clinics are operating 12 hours per day, five days per week. Based on the vaccine supply allocated by the County, they are currently able to provide 3,000 vaccination appointments per week. They expect to increase to 6,000 appointments per week by mid-February, based on the vaccine supply they expect to receive.
John Muir has a COVID-19 hotline with recorded information at 925-952-2300.

This information was double checked on 2021-01-18
As of 2021-02-08 Costco is still not vaccinating in CA. They are vaccinating on a very "limited" basis in OR, WA, NYC, and PR. Check back frequently as they will expand their distribution as supply increases.
As of Feb 7, we do not believe Lucky Pharmacy is vaccinating for covid in California and they have not yet announced when they expect to receive supply.
